newsitem.title: FRANCE: Bordeaux air cargo traffic down 7pct Jan-Sept 1996.
newsitem.headline: Bordeaux air cargo traffic down 7pct Jan-Sept 1996.

text.p: Bordeaux's Merignac airport said it handled 5,631 tonnes of air cargo traffic in the first nine months of 1996, down seven percent on the same period last year.
Last month, United Parcel Service of America, launched a weekday feeder service between Lyon-Satolas airport and Bordeaux using two-tonne capacity Beechcraft 1900 aircraft.
Bordeaux is also part of DHL's Worldwide Express ' weekday Brussels-western France air cargo service.
The service' itinerary reads Brussels-Nantes-Bordeaux and uses a 6.5 tonnes-capacity Convair aircraft.
Airfreight is also carried in the bellyholds of passenger aircraft operating domestic, European and long-haul services from Bordeaux.

Since the beginning of October French airline, Air Liberte has withdrawn its twice-weekly Airbus 310-200 passenger frequencies between Bordeaux and Abidjan, capital of the Ivory Coast, which had offered four to five tonnes of freight capacity per flight
Several airlines also operate trucking services for airfreight from Bordeaux.
Postal traffic handled at Bordeaux totalled 9,585 tonnes, an increase of 20 percent on 1995 levels.

French airline, L'Aeropostale, carries overnight mail between its Paris-Charles de Gaulle hub and Bordeaux on a regular basis using a Boeing 737QC aircraft. - Air Cargo Newsroom Tel+44 171 542 7706 Fax+44 171 542 5017
